intro: Plagioceltis, commonly known as the genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae, consists of several species native to various regions of the world. These plants are characterized by their composite flower heads, which are made up of numerous small florets arranged in a circular pattern. The leaves of Plagioceltis species are typically alternate, often lanceolate or elliptic in shape, and may have serrated edges. They are generally herbaceous, with some species exhibiting a degree of succulence. Plagioceltis plants are often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
